column1: Uchi////I wasn't terribly excited over the two things I ordered (beet salad
column5: about) and a decent vegetarian sushi roll wrapped in soy paper that was quite tasty
column6: certainly in the league of similar rolls that I've had before in other cities. Upon hearing that I'm a vegetarian
column7: our very friendly waitress told me about the substitutions for making rolls vegetarian. The "protein" (her word
column8: not mine) is fruit or vegetables that didn't sound too enticing and I didn't want to spend the $8-12 per item to find out if it was yet more average. I get it. It's a sushi restaurant. Yet here I am
column9: a lover of sushi for sure
column10: as sushi is not only about the raw fish (sashimi
